title: What is Age Regression and How Does it Influence Mental States and Adult Functioning?
first_phrase: This text delves into the concept of age regression, defined by Erickson as the tendency to exhibit an earlier phase of personality development. The author views it as an interpolation of time-frozen experiences over present reality, leading to mental states unaffected by acquired patterns. Age regression is a common "ingredient" in symptoms, with the potential to create developmental gaps that impede adult functioning. The text highlights how age regression is created by childhood experiences that were not integrated, leading to deep trance phenomena, such as oppositional and hypnotic identities. The text concludes by discussing how Mikie's experience illustrates this concept.

last_phrase: In conclusion, age regression can have a significant impact on adult functioning, creating developmental gaps that may impede and limit interpersonal relationships. By identifying the patterns and triggers leading to age regression and by developing counter-identities, individuals such as Mikie can overcome their past limitations and achieve great success. Indeed, it is never too late to break free from the chain of the past and create a brighter future.
